column1: Reptile is the common name for one of the main groups of land vertebrates. It is not used so much by biologists
column2: who use more accurate terms.The name "reptile" comes from Latin and means "one who creeps". All living reptile species are cold blooded
column4: and lay cleidoic eggs. They excrete uric acid (instead of urea) and have a cloaca. A cloaca is a shared opening for the anus
